summary: Diff implements a visible player avatar (capsule mesh) in LibraryScene, unified movement input from keyboard + mobile joystick, basic jump request handling (Space + mobile trigger) with gravity/ground collision, and adds a mobile controls store plus overlay changes that appear to include a Jump button. Some REQ-51 acceptance criteria (exact English label text and non-interference with other touch controls) cannot be fully verified from the truncated diff snippet.

missing_requirements.requirement: On touch devices, a clearly visible button labeled "Jump" appears in the gameplay HUD alongside the existing mobile controls, and it must not interfere with joystick/look touch interactions.
missing_requirements.reason: MobileControlsOverlay.tsx is truncated before the actual Jump button JSX/label and layout/positioning details. While the code references a handleJumpClick/triggerJump and imports Button, the diff excerpt does not show the rendered Button with the exact label text "Jump" nor enough layout/touch-handling context to confirm it wonâ€™t interfere with joystick or look controls.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a new Zustand store (usePlayerControlsStore) to hold joystick/look/jump state across controls and scene.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest did not specify adding a dedicated controls store; it only required movement/jump behavior and a mobile Jump button. This is an implementation detail not requested explicitly.
